name: Chance-It!
tagline: Simple dice roll game created in JS and JQuery
body:
### Welcome to Chance-It!
Blah blah....

### Technical Details
We've crafted some handsome templates for you to use. Go ahead and continue to layouts to browse through them. You can easily go back to edit your page before publishing. After publishing your page, you can revisit the page generator and switch to another theme. Your Page content will be preserved if it remained markdown format.

### Rules
The rules governing the play of Chance-it are described below.

1.     A game of Chance-it involves two players. The player with the highest total score after all rounds is the winner.
1.     For this program, you are to have the computer act as player 2 and you are player 1. Also, for this program a game will consist of 10 rounds.
1.     During a round, each player takes a turn, resulting in a score for each player for the round.
1.     A turn for a player consists of rolling the dice one or more times. After each roll, the player must decide whether to take the value of that roll or Chance-it in hopes of getting a higher roll.
1.     If a player decides to stop, then their turn ends and their score for that turn is the value of their last roll.
1.     If, in re-rolling, a player rolls any previous roll of this turn, then their turn ends and their score for this turn is zero..

### Authors and Contributors
Game Design and Implementation by Aaron Ye
HTML/CSS Template generated by Github Pages
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
